result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard K McDaniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Richard K McDaniel in court, in custody with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called:  13CF268, 13CF146, 13CF245, 14CF70, & 14CF137.   Rights/Elements.  In 13CF268 Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  In 14CF137 defendant plead no contest to Cts. 6 & 7.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In 13CF268  withhold sentencing, placed on probation for 2 years.  90 days jail with Huber.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample and surcharge.  AODA and comply.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full, and successful completion of probation.  Jail start on 8/15/14 at 7:00 pm.   All other counts dismissed but read in.  In case 14CF137  withhold sentencing placed on probation for 2 years each count.  $443.00 costs, each count, for a total of $886.00.  AODA and comply.  All other counts dismissed but read in.  In 13CF146, 13CF245, 14CF70, all counts dismissed but read in.  Counsel is to write a stipulation for any jail credit due.

Waiver of Right to Prelim filed in 14 CF 70 and 14 CF 137, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, stands mute, not guilty pleas entered, matter to be set for jury trial, Atty Martinez states all matters are resolved, 13 CF 146, 13 CF 245, 13 CF 268, 14 CF 70, and 14 CF 137 to be set for plea/sentencing hearing
preliminary hearing on July 10 at 9:00 a.m.

Cases heard 14CF70, 14CF137, 13CF245, 13CF146 & 13CF268, Defendant Richard K McDaniel in court, in custody with attorney Andrew I Martinez.  Brenda L Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Martinez did not dispute finding that defendant is competent. State did not dispute. Court found defendant competent. 14CF70 & 14CF137 to be set for a preliminary hearings. Remaining cases to track with.
